text: I know this has really nothing at all to do with Ember; nothing to do with Tech even but … you really owe it to yourself to buy a Dragonfly DAC <http://ken.net/2016/05/05/dragonfly-red-dac/>

attachments.service_name: Where In The World is Ken?
attachments.title: Dragonfly Red DAC - Where in the World is Ken Snyder?
attachments.fallback: Where In The World is Ken?: Dragonfly Red DAC - Where in the World is Ken Snyder?

text: You don’t need to by the Red (it’s the high end one) but it will improve your music experience 2-3x if you have good headphones. I have two now. One from my home computer, one for travel (IOS/Macbook).
Does it really make that much of a difference <@U04BD6KB1>? Would you see an improvement when listening to the likes of Spotify?
Are you at the next meetup?
It’s one of the big surprises is how shit the DAC in modern computers are
high-end DAC’s used to cost a fortune and were quite large but not anymore
btw, Spotify is _all_ i listen to these days
Intersting....How much does one of those set you back?
I'm going to try and come to the next meetup if I can manage it.

Well you can get the first generation for about £80; it is brilliant (listening to it right now) but uses more power than IOS puts out so you can’t use it there. For most people though its OSX they use it on so no issue there.
£80 is new I think; maybe ebay for less? Especially as some may be upgrading to the Black and Red models.
